Petition of Orville H. Browning and Others to Zachary Taylor, [7 November 1848 - 5

March 1849]1 (Copy.) The undersigned, citizens of the State ofIllinois, beg leave to recommend one of their fellow-citizens, Col. N. Green Wilcox, to the favorable consideration of the President and Heads of Departments, should

he make application for office, and receive an appointment, we doubt not that the

duties of any station which he would accept, will be discharged with honesty and fidelity.2 (Over.) We cheerfully concur with the above gentlemen in their expression in favor of Mr.

Wilcox, and bear willing testimony to his fine capacity and character.
